text: Since many have undertaken to compile a narrative about the events that have been fulfilled among us,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as they were handed on to us by those who from the beginning were eyewitnesses and servants of the word,
speaker: Narrator

text: I, too, decided, as one having a grasp of everything from the start, to write a well-ordered account for you, most excellent Theophilus,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that you may have a firm grasp of the words in which you have been instructed.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the days of King Herod of Judea, there was a priest named Zechariah, who belonged to the priestly order of Abijah. His wife was descended from the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Both of them were righteous before God, living blamelessly according to all the commandments and regulations of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they had no children because Elizabeth was barren, and both were getting on in years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once when he was serving as priest before God during his section’s turn of duty,
speaker: Narrator

text: he was chosen by lot, according to the custom of the priesthood, to enter the sanctuary of the Lord to offer incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now at the time of the incense offering, the whole assembly of the people was praying outside.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then there appeared to him an angel of the Lord, standing at the right side of the altar of incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Zechariah saw him, he was terrified, and fear overwhelmed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel said to him, “Do not be afraid, Zechariah, for your prayer has been heard. Your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you will name him John.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he will be great in the sight of the Lord. He must never drink wine or strong drink; even before his birth he will be filled with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will turn many of the people of Israel to the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: With the spirit and power of Elijah he will go before him, to turn the hearts of parents to their children and the disobedient to the wisdom of the righteous, to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Zechariah said to the angel, “How can I know that this will happen? For I am an old man, and my wife is getting on in years.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel replied, “I am Gabriel. I stand in the presence of God, and I have been sent to speak to you and to bring you this good news.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, because you did not believe my words, which will be fulfilled in their time, you will become mute, unable to speak, until the day these things occur.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile the people were waiting for Zechariah and wondering at his delay in the sanctuary.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he did come out, he was unable to speak to them, and they realized that he had seen a vision in the sanctuary. He kept motioning to them and remained unable to speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his time of service was ended, he returned to his home.
speaker: Narrator

text: After those days his wife Elizabeth conceived, and for five months she remained in seclusion. She said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is what the Lord has done for me in this time, when he looked favorably on me and took away the disgrace I have endured among my people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In the sixth month the angel Gabriel was sent by God to a town in Galilee called Nazareth,
speaker: Narrator

text: to a virgin engaged to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. The virgin’s name was Mary.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he came to her and said, “Greetings, favored one! The Lord is with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But she was much perplexed by his words and pondered what sort of greeting this might be.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel said to her, “Do not be afraid, Mary, for you have found favor with God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And now, you will conceive in your womb and bear a son, and you will name him Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High, and the Lord God will give to him the throne of his ancestor David.
speaker: Jesus

text: He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of his kingdom there will be no end.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary said to the angel, “How can this be, since I am a virgin?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel said to her, “The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child to be born will be holy; he will be called Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And now, your relative Elizabeth in her old age has also conceived a son, and this is the sixth month for her who was said to be barren.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nothing will be impossible with God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Mary said, “Here am I, the servant of the Lord; let it be with me according to your word.” Then the angel departed from her.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days Mary set out and went with haste to a Judean town in the hill country,
speaker: Narrator

text: where she entered the house of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Elizabeth heard Mary’s greeting, the child leaped in her womb. And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit
speaker: Narrator

text: and exclaimed with a loud cry, “Blessed are you among women, and blessed is the fruit of your womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: And why has this happened to me, that the mother of my Lord comes to me?
speaker: Narrator

text: For as soon as I heard the sound of your greeting, the child in my womb leaped for joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed is she who believed that there would be a fulfillment of what was spoken to her by the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And Mary said,
“My soul magnifies the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for he has looked with favor on the lowly state of his servant.
    Surely from now on all generations will call me blessed,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for the Mighty One has done great things for me,
    and holy is his name;
speaker: Narrator

text:
indeed, his mercy is for those who fear him
    from generation to generation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has shown strength with his arm;
    he has scattered the proud in the imagination of their hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has brought down the powerful from their thrones
    and lifted up the lowly;
speaker: Narrator

text:
he has filled the hungry with good things
    and sent the rich away empty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has come to the aid of his child Israel,
    in remembrance of his mercy,
speaker: Narrator

text:
according to the promise he made to our ancestors,
    to Abraham and to his descendants forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mary remained with her about three months and then returned to her home.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the time came for Elizabeth to give birth, and she bore a son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her neighbors and relatives heard that the Lord had shown his great mercy to her, and they rejoiced with her.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and they were going to name him Zechariah after his father.
speaker: Narrator

text: But his mother said, “No; he is to be called John.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to her, “None of your relatives has this name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they began motioning to his father to find out what name he wanted to give him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked for a writing tablet and wrote, “His name is John.” And all of them were amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately his mouth was opened and his tongue freed, and he began to speak, praising God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear came over all their neighbors, and all these things were talked about throughout the entire hill country of Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who heard them pondered them and said, “What then will this child become?” For indeed the hand of the Lord was with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his father Zechariah was filled with the Holy Spirit and prophesied:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Blessed be the Lord God of Israel,
    for he has looked favorably on his people and redeemed them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has raised up a mighty savior for us
    in the house of his child David,
speaker: Narrator

text: as he spoke through the mouth of his holy prophets from of old,
speaker: Narrator

text: that we would be saved from our enemies and from the hand of all who hate us.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus he has shown the mercy promised to our ancestors
    and has remembered his holy covenant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
the oath that he swore to our ancestor Abraham,
to grant us
speaker: Narrator

text:
that we, being rescued from the hands of our enemies,
might serve him without fear,
speaker: Narrator

text:
in holiness and righteousness
    in his presence all our days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most High,
    for you will go before the Lord to prepare his ways,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to give his people knowledge of salvation
    by the forgiveness of their sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of the tender mercy of our God,
    the dawn from on high will break upon us,
speaker: Narrator

text:
to shine upon those who sit in darkness and in the shadow of death,
    to guide our feet into the way of peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The child grew and became strong in spirit, and he was in the wilderness until the day he appeared publicly to Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days a decree went out from Caesar Augustus that all the world should be registered.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was the first registration and was taken while Quirinius was governor of Syria.
speaker: Narrator

text: All went to their own towns to be registered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph also went from the town of Nazareth in Galilee to Judea, to the city of David called Bethlehem, because he was descended from the house and family of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went to be registered with Mary, to whom he was engaged and who was expecting a child.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were there, the time came for her to deliver her child.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she gave birth to her firstborn son and wrapped him in bands of cloth and laid him in a manger, because there was no place in the guest room.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in that same region there were shepherds living in the fields, keeping watch over their flock by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then an angel of the Lord stood before them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the angel said to them, “Do not be afraid, for see, I am bringing you good news of great joy for all the people:
speaker: Narrator

text: to you is born this day in the city of David a Savior, who is the Messiah, the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will be a sign for you: you will find a child wrapped in bands of cloth and lying in a manger.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And suddenly there was with the angel a multitude of the heavenly host, praising God and saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Glory to God in the highest heaven,
    and on earth peace among those whom he favors!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the angels had left them and gone into heaven, the shepherds said to one another, “Let us go now to Bethlehem and see this thing that has taken place, which the Lord has made known to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went with haste and found Mary and Joseph and the child lying in the manger.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they saw this, they made known what had been told them about this child,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds told them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Mary treasured all these words and pondered them in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all they had heard and seen, just as it had been told them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the eighth day came, it was time to circumcise the child, and he was called Jesus, the name given by the angel before he was conceived in the womb.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the time came for their purification according to the law of Moses, they brought him up to Jerusalem to present him to the Lord
speaker: Narrator

text: (as it is written in the law of the Lord, “Every firstborn male shall be designated as holy to the Lord”),
speaker: Narrator

text: and they offered a sacrifice according to what is stated in the law of the Lord, “a pair of turtledoves or two young pigeons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a man in Jerusalem whose name was Simeon; this man was righteous and devout, looking forward to the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit rested on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: It had been revealed to him by the Holy Spirit that he would not see death before he had seen the Lord’s Messiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Guided by the Spirit, Simeon came into the temple, and when the parents brought in the child Jesus to do for him what was customary under the law,
speaker: Narrator

text: Simeon took him in his arms and praised God, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Master, now you are dismissing your servant in peace,
    according to your word,
speaker: Narrator

text: for my eyes have seen your salvation,
speaker: Narrator

text: which you have prepared in the presence of all peoples,
speaker: Narrator

text:
a light for revelation to the gentiles
    and for glory to your people Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the child’s father and mother were amazed at what was being said about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simeon blessed them and said to his mother Mary, “This child is destined for the falling and the rising of many in Israel and to be a sign that will be opposed
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the inner thoughts of many will be revealed—and a sword will pierce your own soul, too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: There was also a prophet, Anna the daughter of Phanuel, of the tribe of Asher. She was of a great age, having lived with her husband seven years after her marriage,
speaker: Narrator

text: then as a widow to the age of eighty-four. She never left the temple but worshiped there with fasting and prayer night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that moment she came and began to praise God and to speak about the child to all who were looking for the redemption of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had finished everything required by the law of the Lord, they returned to Galilee, to their own town of Nazareth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The child grew and became strong, filled with wisdom, and the favor of God was upon him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now every year his parents went to Jerusalem for the festival of the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he was twelve years old, they went up as usual for the festival.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the festival was ended and they started to return, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem, but his parents were unaware of this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Assuming that he was in the group of travelers, they went a day’s journey. Then they started to look for him among their relatives and friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they did not find him, they returned to Jerusalem to search for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After three days they found him in the temple, sitting among the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all who heard him were amazed at his understanding and his answers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his parents saw him they were astonished, and his mother said to him, “Child, why have you treated us like this? Your father and I have been anxiously looking for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Why were you searching for me? Did you not know that I must be in my Father’s house?”
speaker: Jesus

text: But they did not understand what he said to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he went down with them and came to Nazareth and was obedient to them, and his mother treasured all these things in her heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus increased in wisdom and in years and in divine and human favor.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the fifteenth year of the reign of Tiberius Caesar, when Pontius Pilate was governor of Judea, and Herod was ruler of Galilee, and his brother Philip ruler of the region of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias ruler of Abilene,
speaker: Narrator

text: during the high priesthood of Annas and Caiaphas, the word of God came to John son of Zechariah in the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went into all the region around the Jordan, proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins,
speaker: Narrator

text:
as it is written in the book of the words of the prophet Isaiah,
“The voice of one crying out in the wilderness:
‘Prepare the way of the Lord;
    make his paths straight.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Every valley shall be filled,
    and every mountain and hill shall be made low,
and the crooked shall be made straight,
    and the rough ways made smooth,
speaker: Narrator

text: and all flesh shall see the salvation of God.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: John said to the crowds coming out to be baptized by him, “You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, bear fruits worthy of repentance, and do not begin to say to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham as our ancestor,’ for I tell you, God is able from these stones to raise up children to Abraham.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even now the ax is lying at the root of the trees; therefore every tree that does not bear good fruit will be cut down and thrown into the fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the crowds asked him, “What, then, should we do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: In reply he said to them, “Whoever has two coats must share with anyone who has none, and whoever has food must do likewise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Even tax collectors came to be baptized, and they asked him, “Teacher, what should we do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Collect no more than the amount prescribed for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Soldiers also asked him, “And we, what should we do?” He said to them, “Do not extort money from anyone by threats or false accusation, and be satisfied with your wages.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As the people were filled with expectation and all were questioning in their hearts concerning John, whether he might be the Messiah,
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered all of them by saying, “I baptize you with water, but one who is more powerful than I is coming; I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: His winnowing fork is in his hand to clear his threshing floor and to gather the wheat into his granary, but the chaff he will burn with unquenchable fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So with many other exhortations he proclaimed the good news to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Herod the ruler, who had been rebuked by him because of Herodias, his brother’s wife, and because of all the evil things that Herod had done,
speaker: Narrator

text: added to them all by shutting up John in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all the people were baptized and when Jesus also had been baptized and was praying, the heaven was opened,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the Holy Spirit descended upon him in bodily form like a dove. And a voice came from heaven, “You are my Son, the Beloved; with you I am well pleased.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was about thirty years old when he began his work. He was the son (as was thought) of Joseph son of Heli,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Matthat, son of Levi, son of Melchi, son of Jannai, son of Joseph,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Mattathias, son of Amos, son of Nahum, son of Esli, son of Naggai,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Maath, son of Mattathias, son of Semein, son of Josech, son of Joda,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Joanan, son of Rhesa, son of Zerubbabel, son of Shealtiel, son of Neri,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Melchi, son of Addi, son of Cosam, son of Elmadam, son of Er,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Joshua, son of Eliezer, son of Jorim, son of Matthat, son of Levi,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Simeon, son of Judah, son of Joseph, son of Jonam, son of Eliakim,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Melea, son of Menna, son of Mattatha, son of Nathan, son of David,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Jesse, son of Obed, son of Boaz, son of Sala, son of Nahshon,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Amminadab, son of Admin, son of Arni, son of Hezron, son of Perez, son of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Jacob, son of Isaac, son of Abraham, son of Terah, son of Nahor,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Serug, son of Reu, son of Peleg, son of Eber, son of Shelah,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Cainan, son of Arphaxad, son of Shem, son of Noah, son of Lamech,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Methuselah, son of Enoch, son of Jared, son of Mahalaleel, son of Cainan,
speaker: Narrator

text: son of Enos, son of Seth, son of Adam, son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan and was led by the Spirit in the wilderness,
speaker: Narrator

text: where for forty days he was tested by the devil. He ate nothing at all during those days, and when they were over he was famished.
speaker: Narrator

text: The devil said to him, “If you are the Son of God, command this stone to become a loaf of bread.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “It is written, ‘One does not live by bread alone.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil led him up and showed him in an instant all the kingdoms of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the devil said to him, “To you I will give all this authority and their glory, for it has been given over to me, and I give it to anyone I please.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you, then, will worship me, it will all be yours.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Jesus answered him, “It is written,
‘Worship the Lord your God,
    and serve only him.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: Then the devil led him to Jerusalem and placed him on the pinnacle of the temple and said to him, “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down from here,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
and
‘On their hands they will bear you up,
    so that you will not dash your foot against a stone.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “It is said, ‘Do not put the Lord your God to the test.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: When the devil had finished every test, he departed from him until an opportune time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus, in the power of the Spirit, returned to Galilee, and a report about him spread through all the surrounding region.
speaker: Narrator

text: He began to teach in their synagogues and was praised by everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to Nazareth, where he had been brought up, he went to the synagogue on the Sabbath day, as was his custom. He stood up to read,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the scroll of the prophet Isaiah was given to him. He unrolled the scroll and found the place where it was written:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The Spirit of the Lord is upon me,
    because he has anointed me
        to bring good news to the poor.
He has sent me to proclaim release to the captives
    and recovery of sight to the blind,
        to set free those who are oppressed,
speaker: Jesus

text: to proclaim the year of the Lord’s favor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he rolled up the scroll, gave it back to the attendant, and sat down. The eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he began to say to them, “Today this scripture has been fulfilled in your hearing.”
speaker: Jesus

text: All spoke well of him and were amazed at the gracious words that came from his mouth. They said, “Is this not Joseph’s son?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Doubtless you will quote to me this proverb, ‘Doctor, cure yourself!’ And you will say, ‘Do here also in your hometown the things that we have heard you did at Capernaum.’ ”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he said, “Truly I tell you, no prophet is accepted in his hometown.
speaker: Jesus

text: But the truth is, there were many widows in Israel in the time of Elijah, when the heaven was shut up three years and six months and there was a severe famine over all the land,
speaker: Jesus

text: yet Elijah was sent to none of them except to a widow at Zarephath in Sidon.
speaker: Jesus

text: There were also many with a skin disease in Israel in the time of the prophet Elisha, and none of them was cleansed except Naaman the Syrian.”
speaker: Jesus

text: When they heard this, all in the synagogue were filled with rage.
speaker: Jesus

text: They got up, drove him out of the town, and led him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, so that they might hurl him off the cliff.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he passed through the midst of them and went on his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went down to Capernaum, a city in Galilee, and was teaching them on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were astounded at his teaching because he spoke with authority.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the synagogue there was a man who had the spirit of an unclean demon, and he cried out with a loud voice,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Leave us alone! What have you to do with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are, the Holy One of God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: But Jesus rebuked him, saying, “Be quiet and come out of him!” Then the demon, throwing the man down before them, came out of him without doing him any harm.
speaker: Jesus

text: They were all astounded and kept saying to one another, “What kind of word is this, that with authority and power he commands the unclean spirits and they come out?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And news about him began to reach every place in the region.
speaker: Narrator

text: After leaving the synagogue he entered Simon’s house. Now Simon’s mother-in-law was suffering from a high fever, and they asked him about her.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he stood over her and rebuked the fever, and it left her. Immediately she got up and began to serve them.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the sun was setting, all those caring for any who were sick with various kinds of diseases brought them to him, and he laid his hands on each of them and cured them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, demons also came out of many, shouting, “You are the Son of God!” But he rebuked them and would not allow them to speak, because they knew that he was the Messiah.
speaker: Jesus

text: At daybreak he departed and went into a deserted place. And the crowds began looking for him, and when they reached him they tried to keep him from leaving them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “I must proclaim the good news of the kingdom of God to the other cities also, for I was sent for this purpose.”
speaker: Jesus

text: So he continued proclaiming the message in the synagogues of Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once while Jesus was standing beside the Lake of Gennesaret and the crowd was pressing in on him to hear the word of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: he saw two boats there at the shore of the lake; the fishermen had gotten out of them and were washing their nets.
speaker: Narrator

text: He got into one of the boats, the one belonging to Simon, and asked him to put out a little way from the shore. Then he sat down and taught the crowds from the boat.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had finished speaking, he said to Simon, “Put out into the deep water and let down your nets for a catch.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon answered, “Master, we have worked all night long but have caught nothing. Yet if you say so, I will let down the nets.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had done this, they caught so many fish that their nets were beginning to burst.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they signaled their partners in the other boat to come and help them. And they came and filled both boats, so that they began to sink.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus’s knees, saying, “Go away from me, Lord, for I am a sinful man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he and all who were with him were astounded at the catch of fish that they had taken,
speaker: Narrator

text: and so also were James and John, sons of Zebedee, who were partners with Simon. Then Jesus said to Simon, “Do not be afraid; from now on you will be catching people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had brought their boats to shore, they left everything and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once when he was in one of the cities, a man covered with a skin disease was there. When he saw Jesus, he bowed with his face to the ground and begged him, “Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus stretched out his hand, touched him, and said, “I am willing. Be made clean.” Immediately the skin disease left him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he ordered him to tell no one. “But go, show yourself to the priest, and, as Moses commanded, make an offering for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But now more than ever the word about Jesus spread abroad; many crowds were gathering to hear him and to be cured of their diseases.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, he would slip away to deserted places and pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: One day while he was teaching, Pharisees and teachers of the law who had come from every village of Galilee and Judea and from Jerusalem were sitting nearby, and the power of the Lord was with him to heal.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then some men came carrying a paralyzed man on a stretcher. They were trying to bring him in and lay him before Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: but, finding no way to bring him in because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down on the stretcher through the tiles into the middle of the crowd in front of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw their faith, he said, “Friend, your sins are forgiven you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the scribes and the Pharisees began to question, “Who is this who is speaking blasphemies? Who can forgive sins but God alone?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus perceived their questionings, he answered them, “Why do you raise such questions in your hearts?
speaker: Narrator

text: Which is easier: to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven you,’ or to say, ‘Stand up and walk’?
speaker: Narrator

text: But so that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins”—he said to the one who was paralyzed—“I say to you, stand up and take your stretcher and go to your home.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Immediately he stood up before them, took what he had been lying on, and went to his home, glorifying God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Amazement seized all of them, and they glorified God and were filled with fear, saying, “We have seen incredible things today.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After this he went out and saw a tax collector named Levi sitting at the tax-collection station, and he said to him, “Follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he got up, left everything, and followed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Levi gave a great banquet for him in his house, and there was a large crowd of tax collectors and others reclining at the table with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees and their scribes were complaining to his disciples, saying, “Why do you eat and drink with tax collectors and sinners?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Those who are well have no need of a physician but those who are sick;
speaker: Narrator

text: I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to him, “John’s disciples, like the disciples of the Pharisees, frequently fast and pray, but your disciples eat and drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “You cannot make wedding attendants fast while the bridegroom is with them, can you?
speaker: Narrator

text: The days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast in those days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He also told them a parable: “No one tears a piece from a new garment and sews it on an old garment; otherwise, not only will one tear the new garment, but the piece from the new will not match the old garment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Similarly, no one puts new wine into old wineskins; otherwise, the new wine will burst the skins and will spill out, and the skins will be ruined.
speaker: Narrator

text: But new wine must be put into fresh wineskins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And no one after drinking old wine desires new wine but says, ‘The old is good.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: One Sabbath while Jesus was going through some grain fields, his disciples plucked some heads of grain, rubbed them in their hands, and ate them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of the Pharisees said, “Why are you doing what is not lawful on the Sabbath?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Have you not read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?
speaker: Narrator

text: How he entered the house of God and took and ate the bread of the Presence, which it is not lawful for any but the priests to eat, and gave some to his companions?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “The Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On another Sabbath he entered the synagogue and taught, and there was a man there whose right hand was withered.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribes and the Pharisees were watching him to see whether he would cure on the Sabbath, so that they might find grounds to bring an accusation against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he knew what they were thinking, and he said to the man who had the withered hand, “Come and stand in the middle.” He got up and stood there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “I ask you, is it lawful to do good or to do harm on the Sabbath, to save life or to destroy it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: After looking around at all of them, he said to him, “Stretch out your hand.” He did so, and his hand was restored.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were filled with fury and began discussing with one another what they might do to Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now during those days he went out to the mountain to pray, and he spent the night in prayer to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when day came, he called his disciples and chose twelve of them, whom he also named apostles:
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon, whom he named Peter, and his brother Andrew, and James, and John, and Philip, and Bartholomew,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Matthew, and Thomas, and James son of Alphaeus, and Simon, who was called the Zealot,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Judas son of James, and Judas Iscariot, who became a traitor.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came down with them and stood on a level place with a great crowd of his disciples and a great multitude of people from all Judea, Jerusalem, and the coast of Tyre and Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They had come to hear him and to be healed of their diseases, and those who were troubled with unclean spirits were cured.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone in the crowd was trying to touch him, for power came out from him and healed all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he looked up at his disciples and said:
“Blessed are you who are poor,
    for yours is the kingdom of God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Blessed are you who are hungry now,
    for you will be filled.
“Blessed are you who weep now,
    for you will laugh.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Blessed are you when people hate you and when they exclude you, revile you, and defame you on account of the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rejoice on that day and leap for joy, for surely your reward is great in heaven, for that is how their ancestors treated the prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But woe to you who are rich,
    for you have received your consolation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Woe to you who are full now,
    for you will be hungry.
“Woe to you who are laughing now,
    for you will mourn and weep.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you when all speak well of you, for that is how their ancestors treated the false prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But I say to you who are listening: Love your enemies; do good to those who hate you;
speaker: Narrator

text: bless those who curse you; pray for those who mistreat you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If anyone strikes you on the cheek, offer the other also, and from anyone who takes away your coat do not withhold even your shirt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give to everyone who asks of you, and if anyone takes away what is yours, do not ask for it back again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do to others as you would have them do to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you love those who love you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners love those who love them.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you do good to those who do good to you, what credit is that to you? For even sinners do the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you lend to those from whom you expect to receive payment, what credit is that to you? Even sinners lend to sinners, to receive as much again.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, love your enemies, do good, and lend, expecting nothing in return. Your reward will be great, and you will be children of the Most High, for he himself is kind to the ungrateful and the wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be merciful, just as your Father is merciful.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Do not judge, and you will not be judged; do not condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven;
speaker: Narrator

text: give, and it will be given to you. A good measure, pressed down, shaken together, running over, will be put into your lap, for the measure you give will be the measure you get back.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He also told them a parable: “Can a blind person guide a blind person? Will not both fall into a pit?
speaker: Narrator

text: A disciple is not above the teacher, but every disciple who is fully qualified will be like the teacher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you see the speck in your neighbor’s eye but do not notice the log in your own eye?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or how can you say to your neighbor, ‘Friend, let me take out the speck in your eye,’ when you yourself do not see the log in your own eye? You hypocrite, first take the log out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly to take the speck out of your neighbor’s eye.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No good tree bears bad fruit, nor again does a bad tree bear good fruit;
speaker: Narrator

text: for each tree is known by its own fruit. For people do not gather figs from thorns, nor do they pick grapes from a bramble bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good person out of the good treasure of the heart produces good, and the evil person out of evil treasure produces evil, for it is out of the abundance of the heart that the mouth speaks.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why do you call me ‘Lord, Lord,’ and do not do what I tell you?
speaker: Narrator

text: I will show you what someone is like who comes to me, hears my words, and acts on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: That one is like a man building a house who dug deeply and laid the foundation on rock; when a flood arose, the river burst against that house but could not shake it because it had been well built.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the one who hears and does not act is like a man who built a house on the ground without a foundation. When the river burst against it, it quickly collapsed, and great was the ruin of that house.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus had finished all his sayings in the hearing of the people, he entered Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: A centurion there had a slave whom he valued highly and who was ill and close to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he heard about Jesus, he sent some Jewish elders to him, asking him to come and heal his slave.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came to Jesus, they appealed to him earnestly, saying, “He is worthy to have you do this for him,
speaker: Narrator

text: for he loves our people, and it is he who built our synagogue for us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus went with them, but when he was not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to say to him, “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy to have you come under my roof;
speaker: Narrator

text: therefore I did not presume to come to you. But only speak the word, and let my servant be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I also am a man set under authority, with soldiers under me, and I say to one, ‘Go,’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come,’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this,’ and the slave does it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this he was amazed at him, and, turning to the crowd following him, he said, “I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When those who had been sent returned to the house, they found the slave in good health.
speaker: Narrator

text: Soon afterward he went to a town called Nain, and his disciples and a large crowd went with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he approached the gate of the town, a man who had died was being carried out. He was his mother’s only son, and she was a widow, and with her was a large crowd from the town.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Lord saw her, he was moved with compassion for her and said to her, “Do not cry.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he came forward and touched the bier, and the bearers stopped. And he said, “Young man, I say to you, rise!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead man sat up and began to speak, and Jesus gave him to his mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Fear seized all of them, and they glorified God, saying, “A great prophet has risen among us!” and “God has visited his people!”
speaker: Narrator

text: This word about him spread throughout the whole of Judea and all the surrounding region.
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples of John reported all these things to him. So John summoned two of his disciples
speaker: Narrator

text: and sent them to the Lord to ask, “Are you the one who is to come, or are we to expect someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the men had come to him, they said, “John the Baptist has sent us to you to ask, ‘Are you the one who is to come, or are we to expect someone else?’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus had just then cured many people of diseases, afflictions, and evil spirits and had given sight to many who were blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answered them, “Go and tell John what you have seen and heard: the blind receive their sight; the lame walk; those with a skin disease are cleansed; the deaf hear; the dead are raised; the poor have good news brought to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And blessed is anyone who takes no offense at me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When John’s messengers had gone, Jesus began to speak to the crowds about John: “What did you go out into the wilderness to look at? A reed shaken by the wind?
speaker: Narrator

text: What, then, did you go out to see? Someone dressed in soft robes? Look, those who put on fine clothing and live in luxury are in royal palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text: What, then, did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is the one about whom it is written,
‘See, I am sending my messenger ahead of you,
    who will prepare your way before you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “I tell you, among those born of women no one is greater than John, yet the least in the kingdom of God is greater than he.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (And all the people who heard this, including the tax collectors, acknowledged the justice of God, having been baptized with John’s baptism.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Pharisees and the experts in the law, not having been baptized by him, rejected God’s purpose for themselves.)
speaker: Narrator

text: “To what, then, will I compare the people of this generation, and what are they like?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: “For John the Baptist has come eating no bread and drinking no wine, and you say, ‘He has a demon’;
speaker: Narrator

text: the Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, ‘Look, a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, wisdom is vindicated by all her children.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the Pharisees asked Jesus to eat with him, and when he went into the Pharisee’s house he reclined to dine.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a woman in the city who was a sinner, having learned that he was eating in the Pharisee’s house, brought an alabaster jar of ointment.
speaker: Narrator

text: She stood behind him at his feet, weeping, and began to bathe his feet with her tears and to dry them with her hair, kissing his feet and anointing them with the ointment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when the Pharisee who had invited him saw it, he said to himself, “If this man were a prophet, he would have known who and what kind of woman this is who is touching him, that she is a sinner.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus spoke up and said to him, “Simon, I have something to say to you.” “Teacher,” he replied, “speak.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “A certain moneylender had two debtors; one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they could not pay, he canceled the debts for both of them. Now which of them will love him more?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon answered, “I suppose the one for whom he canceled the greater debt.” And Jesus said to him, “You have judged rightly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then turning toward the woman, he said to Simon, “Do you see this woman? I entered your house; you gave me no water for my feet, but she has bathed my feet with her tears and dried them with her hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: You gave me no kiss, but from the time I came in she has not stopped kissing my feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: You did not anoint my head with oil, but she has anointed my feet with ointment.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, I tell you, her many sins have been forgiven; hence she has shown great love. But the one to whom little is forgiven loves little.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to her, “Your sins are forgiven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who were at the table with him began to say among themselves, “Who is this who even forgives sins?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to the woman, “Your faith has saved you; go in peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Soon afterward he went on through one town and village after another, proclaiming and bringing the good news of the kingdom of God. The twelve were with him,
speaker: Narrator

text: as well as some women who had been cured of evil spirits and infirmities: Mary, called Magdalene, from whom seven demons had gone out,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Joanna, the wife of Herod’s steward Chuza, and Susanna, and many others, who ministered to them out of their own resources.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a large crowd was gathering, as people were coming to him from town after town, he said in a parable:
speaker: Narrator

text: “A sower went out to sow his seed, and as he sowed some fell on a path and was trampled on, and the birds of the air ate it up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some fell on rock, and as it grew up it withered for lack of moisture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some fell among thorns, and the thorns grew with it and choked it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some fell into good soil, and when it grew it produced a hundredfold.” As he said this, he called out, “If you have ears to hear, then hear!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his disciples asked him what this parable meant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said, “To you it has been given to know the secrets of the kingdom of God, but to others I speak in parables, so that
‘looking they may not perceive
    and hearing they may not understand.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now the parable is this: The seed is the word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ones on the path are those who have heard; then the devil comes and takes away the word from their hearts, so that they may not believe and be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: The ones on the rock are those who, when they hear the word, receive it with joy. But these have no root; they believe only for a while and in a time of testing fall away.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for what fell among the thorns, these are the ones who hear, but as they go on their way they are choked by the cares and riches and pleasures of life, and their fruit does not mature.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for that in the good soil, these are the ones who, when they hear the word, hold it fast in an honest and good heart and bear fruit with endurance.
speaker: Narrator

text: “No one after lighting a lamp hides it under a jar or puts it under a bed; rather, one puts it on a lampstand, so that those who enter may see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: For nothing is hidden that will not be disclosed, nor is anything secret that will not become known and come to light.
speaker: Narrator

text: So pay attention to how you listen, for to those who have, more will be given, and from those who do not have, even what they seem to have will be taken away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then his mother and his brothers came to him, but they could not reach him because of the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he was told, “Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to see you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “My mother and my brothers are those who hear the word of God and do it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One day he got into a boat with his disciples, and he said to them, “Let us go across to the other side of the lake.” So they put out,
speaker: Narrator

text: and while they were sailing he fell asleep. A windstorm swept down on the lake, and the boat was filling with water, and they were in danger.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went to him and woke him up, shouting, “Master, Master, we are perishing!” And waking up, he rebuked the wind and the raging waves; they ceased, and there was a calm.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “Where is your faith?” They were terrified and amazed and said to one another, “Who then is this, that he commands even the winds and the water and they obey him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they arrived at the region of the Gerasenes, which is opposite Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he stepped out on shore, a man from the city who had demons met him. For a long time he had not worn any clothes, and he did not live in a house but in the tombs.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before him, shouting, “What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? I beg you, do not torment me,”
speaker: Narrator

text: for Jesus had commanded the unclean spirit to come out of the man. (For many times it had seized him; he was kept under guard and bound with chains and shackles, but he would break the bonds and be driven by the demon into the wilds.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then asked him, “What is your name?” He said, “Legion,” for many demons had entered him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They begged him not to order them to go back into the abyss.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there on the hillside a large herd of swine was feeding, and the demons begged Jesus to let them enter these. So he gave them permission.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the demons came out of the man and entered the swine, and the herd stampeded down the steep bank into the lake and was drowned.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the swineherds saw what had happened, they ran off and told it in the city and in the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then people came out to see what had happened, and when they came to Jesus, they found the man from whom the demons had gone sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind. And they became frightened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had seen it told them how the one who had been possessed by demons had been healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the whole throng of people of the surrounding region of the Gerasenes asked Jesus to leave them, for they were seized with great fear. So he got into the boat and returned.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man from whom the demons had gone out begged that he might be with him, but Jesus sent him away, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Return to your home, and declare how much God has done for you.” So he went away, proclaiming throughout the city how much Jesus had done for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Jesus returned, the crowd welcomed him, for they were all waiting for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then there came a man named Jairus, a leader of the synagogue. He fell at Jesus’s feet and began pleading with him to come to his house,
speaker: Narrator

text:
for he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying.
As he went, the crowds pressed in on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a woman who had been suffering from a flow of blood for twelve years, and though she had spent all she had on physicians, no one could cure her.
speaker: Narrator

text: She came up behind him and touched the fringe of his cloak, and immediately her flow of blood stopped.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus asked, “Who touched me?” When they all denied it, Peter said, “Master, the crowds are hemming you in and pressing against you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said, “Someone touched me, for I noticed that power had gone out from me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the woman realized that she could not remain hidden, she came trembling, and falling down before him, she declared in the presence of all the people why she had touched him and how she had been immediately healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to her, “Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was still speaking, someone came from the synagogue leader’s house to say, “Your daughter is dead; do not trouble the teacher any longer.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus heard this, he replied, “Do not be afraid. Only believe, and she will be saved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to the house, he did not allow anyone to enter with him, except Peter, John, and James and the child’s father and mother.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone was weeping and grieving for her, but he said, “Do not cry, for she is not dead but sleeping.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they laughed at him, knowing that she was dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: But taking her by the hand, he called out, “Child, get up!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Her spirit returned, and she stood up at once, and he directed them to give her something to eat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Her parents were astounded, but he ordered them to tell no one what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus called the twelve together and gave them power and authority over all demons and to cure diseases,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal the sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Take nothing for your journey: no staff, nor bag, nor bread, nor money—not even an extra tunic.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever house you enter, stay there, and leave from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherever they do not welcome you, as you are leaving that town shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they departed and went through the villages, bringing the good news and curing diseases everywhere.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Herod the ruler heard about all that had taken place, and he was perplexed because it was said by some that John had been raised from the dead,
speaker: Narrator

text: by some that Elijah had appeared, and by others that one of the ancient prophets had arisen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod said, “John I beheaded, but who is this about whom I hear such things?” And he tried to see him.
speaker: Narrator

text: On their return the apostles told Jesus all they had done. Then, taking them along, he slipped quietly into a city called Bethsaida.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds found out about it, they followed him, and he welcomed them and spoke to them about the kingdom of God and healed those who needed to be cured.
speaker: Narrator

text: The day was drawing to a close, and the twelve came to him and said, “Send the crowd away, so that they may go into the surrounding villages and countryside to lodge and get provisions, for we are here in a deserted place.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “You give them something to eat.” They said, “We have no more than five loaves and two fish—unless we are to go and buy food for all these people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For there were about five thousand men. And he said to his disciples, “Have them sit down in groups of about fifty each.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They did so and had them all sit down.
speaker: Narrator

text: And taking the five loaves and the two fish, he looked up to heaven and blessed and broke them and gave them to the disciples to set before the crowd.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all ate and were filled, and what was left over was gathered up, twelve baskets of broken pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once when Jesus was praying alone, with only the disciples near him, he asked them, “Who do the crowds say that I am?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered, “John the Baptist; but others, Elijah; and still others, that one of the ancient prophets has arisen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them, “But who do you say that I am?” Peter answered, “The Messiah of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He sternly ordered and commanded them not to tell anyone,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying, “The Son of Man must undergo great suffering and be rejected by the elders, chief priests, and scribes and be killed and on the third day be raised.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to them all, “If any wish to come after me, let them deny themselves and take up their cross daily and follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: For those who want to save their life will lose it, and those who lose their life for my sake will save it.
speaker: Narrator

text: For what does it profit them if they gain the whole world but lose or forfeit themselves?
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who are ashamed of me and of my words, of them the Son of Man will be ashamed when he comes in his glory and the glory of the Father and of the holy angels.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, truly I tell you, there are some standing here who will not taste death before they see the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now about eight days after these sayings Jesus took with him Peter and John and James and went up on the mountain to pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: And while he was praying, the appearance of his face changed, and his clothes became as bright as a flash of lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly they saw two men, Moses and Elijah, talking to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They appeared in glory and were speaking about his exodus, which he was about to fulfill in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Peter and his companions were weighed down with sleep, but as they awoke they saw his glory and the two men who stood with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as they were leaving him, Peter said to Jesus, “Master, it is good for us to be here; let us set up three tents: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah,” not realizing what he was saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was saying this, a cloud came and overshadowed them, and they were terrified as they entered the cloud.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then from the cloud came a voice that said, “This is my Son, my Chosen; listen to him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. And they kept silent and in those days told no one any of the things they had seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day, when they had come down from the mountain, a great crowd met him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then a man from the crowd shouted, “Teacher, I beg you to look at my son; he is my only child.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suddenly a spirit seizes him, and all at once he shrieks. It convulses him until he foams at the mouth; it mauls him and will scarcely leave him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I begged your disciples to cast it out, but they could not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “You faithless and perverse generation, how much longer must I be with you and put up with you? Bring your son here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was being brought forward, the demon dashed him to the ground in convulsions. But Jesus rebuked the unclean spirit, healed the boy, and gave him back to his father.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And all were astounded at the greatness of God.
While everyone was amazed at all that he was doing, he said to his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Let these words sink into your ears: The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into human hands.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they did not understand this saying; its meaning remained concealed from them, so that they could not perceive it. And they were afraid to ask him about this saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: An argument arose among them concerning which one of them was the greatest.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, aware of their inner thoughts, took a little child and put it by his side
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to them, “Whoever welcomes this child in my name welcomes me, and whoever welcomes me welcomes the one who sent me, for the least among all of you is the greatest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered, “Master, we saw someone casting out demons in your name, and we tried to stop him because he does not follow with us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus said to him, “Do not stop him, for whoever is not against you is for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the days drew near for him to be taken up, he set his face to go to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he sent messengers ahead of him. On their way they entered a village of the Samaritans to prepare for his arrival,
speaker: Narrator

text: but they did not receive him because his face was set toward Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When his disciples James and John saw this, they said, “Lord, do you want us to command fire to come down from heaven and consume them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he turned and rebuked them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they went on to another village.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were going along the road, someone said to him, “I will follow you wherever you go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Foxes have holes, and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”
speaker: Narrator

text: To another he said, “Follow me.” But he said, “Lord, first let me go and bury my father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “Let the dead bury their own dead, but as for you, go and proclaim the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Another said, “I will follow you, Lord, but let me first say farewell to those at my home.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to him, “No one who puts a hand to the plow and looks back is fit for the kingdom of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After this the Lord appointed seventy-two others and sent them on ahead of him in pairs to every town and place where he himself intended to go.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few; therefore ask the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go on your way; I am sending you out like lambs into the midst of wolves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Carry no purse, no bag, no sandals, and greet no one on the road.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whatever house you enter, first say, ‘Peace to this house!’
speaker: Narrator

text: And if a person of peace is there, your peace will rest on that person, but if not, it will return to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remain in the same house, eating and drinking whatever they provide, for the laborer deserves to be paid. Do not move about from house to house.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever you enter a town and its people welcome you, eat what is set before you;
speaker: Narrator

text: cure the sick who are there, and say to them, ‘The kingdom of God has come near to you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But whenever you enter a town and they do not welcome you, go out into its streets and say,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Even the dust of your town that clings to our feet, we wipe off in protest against you. Yet know this: the kingdom of God has come near.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, on that day it will be more tolerable for Sodom than for that town.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the deeds of power done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented long ago, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, at the judgment it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you, Capernaum,
will you be exalted to heaven?
    No, you will be brought down to Hades.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whoever listens to you listens to me, and whoever rejects you rejects me, and whoever rejects me rejects the one who sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventy-two returned with joy, saying, “Lord, in your name even the demons submit to us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “I watched Satan fall from heaven like a flash of lightning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, I have given you authority to tread on snakes and scorpions and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing will hurt you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, do not rejoice at this, that the spirits submit to you, but rejoice that your names are written in heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that very hour Jesus rejoiced in the Holy Spirit and said, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, because you have hidden these things from the wise and the intelligent and have revealed them to infants; yes, Father, for such was your gracious will.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one knows who the Son is except the Father or who the Father is except the Son and anyone to whom the Son chooses to reveal him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then turning to the disciples, Jesus said to them privately, “Blessed are the eyes that see what you see!
speaker: Narrator

text: For I tell you that many prophets and kings desired to see what you see but did not see it and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: An expert in the law stood up to test Jesus. “Teacher,” he said, “what must I do to inherit eternal life?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him, “What is written in the law? What do you read there?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind and your neighbor as yourself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, “You have given the right answer; do this, and you will live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But wanting to vindicate himself, he asked Jesus, “And who is my neighbor?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “A man was going down from Jerusalem to Jericho and fell into the hands of robbers, who stripped him, beat him, and took off, leaving him half dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now by chance a priest was going down that road, and when he saw him he passed by on the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: So likewise a Levite, when he came to the place and saw him, passed by on the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: But a Samaritan while traveling came upon him, and when he saw him he was moved with compassion.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went to him and bandaged his wounds, treating them with oil and wine. Then he put him on his own animal, brought him to an inn, and took care of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day he took out two denarii, gave them to the innkeeper, and said, ‘Take care of him, and when I come back I will repay you whatever more you spend.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of these three, do you think, was a neighbor to the man who fell into the hands of the robbers?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “The one who showed him mercy.” Jesus said to him, “Go and do likewise.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now as they went on their way, he entered a certain village where a woman named Martha welcomed him.
speaker: Narrator

text: She had a sister named Mary, who sat at Jesus’s feet and listened to what he was saying.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Martha was distracted by her many tasks, so she came to him and asked, “Lord, do you not care that my sister has left me to do all the work by myself? Tell her, then, to help me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord answered her, “Martha, Martha, you are worried and distracted by many things,
speaker: Narrator

text: but few things are needed—indeed only one. Mary has chosen the better part, which will not be taken away from her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He was praying in a certain place, and after he had finished, one of his disciples said to him, “Lord, teach us to pray, as John taught his disciples.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So he said to them, “When you pray, say:
Father, may your name be revered as holy.
    May your kingdom come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Give us each day our daily bread.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And forgive us our sins,
        for we ourselves forgive everyone indebted to us.
    And do not bring us to the time of trial.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to them, “Suppose one of you has a friend, and you go to him at midnight and say to him, ‘Friend, lend me three loaves of bread,
speaker: Narrator

text: for a friend of mine has arrived, and I have nothing to set before him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And he answers from within, ‘Do not bother me; the door has already been locked, and my children are with me in bed; I cannot get up and give you anything.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you, even though he will not get up and give him anything out of friendship, at least because of his persistence he will get up and give him whatever he needs.
speaker: Narrator

text: “So I say to you, Ask, and it will be given to you; search, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For everyone who asks receives, and everyone who searches finds, and for everyone who knocks, the door will be opened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Is there anyone among you who, if your child asked for a fish, would give a snake instead of a fish?
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if the child asked for an egg, would give a scorpion?
speaker: Narrator

text: If you, then, who are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he was casting out a demon that was mute; when the demon had gone out, the one who had been mute spoke, and the crowds were amazed.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of them said, “He casts out demons by Beelzebul, the ruler of the demons.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others, to test him, kept demanding from him a sign from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he knew what they were thinking and said to them, “Every kingdom divided against itself is laid waste, and a divided household falls.
speaker: Narrator

text: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand?—for you say that I cast out the demons by Beelzebul.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if I cast out the demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your exorcists cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if it is by the finger of God that I cast out the demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a strong man, fully armed, guards his castle, his property is safe.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when one stronger than he attacks him and overpowers him, he takes away his armor in which he trusted and divides his plunder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters.
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the unclean spirit has gone out of a person, it wanders through waterless regions looking for a resting place, but not finding any it says, ‘I will return to my house from which I came.’
speaker: Narrator

text: When it returns, it finds it swept and put in order.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it goes and brings seven other spirits more evil than itself, and they enter and live there, and the last state of that person is worse than the first.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was saying this, a woman in the crowd raised her voice and said to him, “Blessed is the womb that bore you and the breasts that nursed you!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said, “Blessed rather are those who hear the word of God and obey it!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the crowds were increasing, he began to say, “This generation is an evil generation; it asks for a sign, but no sign will be given to it except the sign of Jonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as Jonah became a sign to the people of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be to this generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: The queen of the South will rise at the judgment with the people of this generation and condemn them, because she came from the ends of the earth to listen to the wisdom of Solomon, and indeed, something greater than Solomon is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Nineveh will rise up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it, because they repented at the proclamation of Jonah, and indeed, something greater than Jonah is here!
speaker: Narrator

text: “No one after lighting a lamp puts it in a cellar or under a bushel basket; rather, one puts it on the lampstand so that those who enter may see the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your eye is the lamp of your body. If your eye is healthy, your whole body is full of light, but if it is unhealthy, your body is full of darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore consider whether the light in you is not darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if your whole body is full of light, with no part of it in darkness, it will be as full of light as when a lamp gives you light with its rays.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While he was speaking, a Pharisee invited him to dine with him, so he went in and took his place at the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisee was amazed to see that he did not first wash before dinner.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said to him, “Now you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup and of the dish, but inside you are full of greed and wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: You fools! Did not the one who made the outside make the inside also?
speaker: Narrator

text: So give as alms those things that are within and then everything will be clean for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But woe to you Pharisees! For you tithe mint and rue and herbs of all kinds and neglect justice and the love of God; it is these you ought to have practiced, without neglecting the others.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you Pharisees! For you love to have the seat of honor in the synagogues and to be greeted with respect in the marketplaces.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you! For you are like unmarked graves on which people unknowingly walk.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the experts in the law answered him, “Teacher, when you say these things, you insult us, too.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “Woe also to you experts in the law! For you load people with burdens hard to bear, and you yourselves do not lift a finger to ease them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you! For you build the tombs of the prophets whom your ancestors killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you are witnesses and approve of the deeds of your ancestors, for they killed them, and you build their tombs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason the Wisdom of God said, ‘I will send them prophets and apostles, some of whom they will kill and persecute,’
speaker: Narrator

text: so that this generation may be charged with the blood of all the prophets shed since the foundation of the world,
speaker: Narrator

text: from the blood of Abel to the blood of Zechariah, who perished between the altar and the sanctuary. Yes, I tell you, it will be charged against this generation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Woe to you experts in the law! For you have taken away the key of knowledge; you did not enter yourselves, and you hindered those who were entering.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he went outside, the scribes and the Pharisees became hostile to him and began to interrogate him about many things,
speaker: Narrator

text: lying in wait for him, to catch him in something he might say.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile, when the crowd had gathered by the thousands, so that they trampled on one another, he began to speak first to his disciples, “Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, that is, their hypocrisy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nothing is covered up that will not be uncovered and nothing secret that will not become known.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore whatever you have said in the dark will be heard in the light, and what you have whispered behind closed doors will be proclaimed from the housetops.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I tell you, my friends, do not fear those who kill the body and after that can do nothing more.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I will show you whom to fear: fear the one who, after killing, has authority to cast into hell. Yes, I tell you, fear that one!
speaker: Narrator

text: Are not five sparrows sold for two pennies? Yet not one of them is forgotten in God’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even the hairs of your head are all numbered. Do not be afraid; you are of more value than many sparrows.
speaker: Narrator

text: “And I tell you, everyone who acknowledges me before others, the Son of Man also will acknowledge before the angels of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whoever denies me before others will be denied before the angels of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they bring you before the synagogues, the rulers, and the authorities, do not worry about how or what you will answer or what you are to say,
speaker: Narrator
